insurer_name: Prestige Underwriting Services Limited on behalf of Aviva Insurance Limited (all sections except Legal Expenses which is provided by ARAG plc and underwritten by ARAG Legal Expenses Insurance Company Limited)
coverage_summary: Annual insurance policy designed to protect property owners who rent their homes to guests through short-term letting/hosting activities. Covers damage to buildings and contents caused by guests or visitors during valid bookings, loss of income following claims, liability to others, electric vehicle charging units, and legal expenses. Works alongside existing property insurance.
key_inclusions: Buildings damage (up to £1,000,000 for fire/smoke/explosion, £80,000 for accidental/malicious damage)
Contents damage (up to £100,000 for fire/smoke, £40,000 for accidental/malicious damage)
Theft or attempted theft by guests/visitors (up to £20,000)
Loss of keys and lock replacement (up to £1,000)
Emergency services damage to property (up to £5,000)
Alternative accommodation for host if property uninhabitable (up to £200/day, max £20,000)
Alternative accommodation for guests (up to £150/day, max £5,000)
Cancellation charges for subsequent bookings (up to £200)
Loss of income following covered claims (up to £10,000)
Electric/hybrid vehicle charging points damage (up to £1,500)
Public liability to third parties, guests, and visitors (up to £5,000,000)
Personal injury to host caused by hosting activities (up to £10,000)
Pest infestation damage caused by guests (up to £1,000)
Escape of water or heating oil damage
key_exclusions: Communicable diseases (including COVID-19 and any pandemic)
Damage caused by the policyholder themselves
Wear and tear or gradual damage
Cosmetic damage where functionality not affected
Damage caused by domestic pets (chewing, scratching, fouling)
Damage during professional/domestic cleaning
Motorized vehicle damage
Vermin damage
Blocked sewage pipes
External walls/roofs/communal areas for flats/apartments
Cash, credit cards, vouchers
Guns, sports equipment, scuba diving equipment
Audio/visual software, discs, tapes
Claims during renovations or building work
Non-hosting activity claims
Claims without valid booking
Deposit amounts greater than or equal to claim value
Fraudulent claims
War, terrorism, radioactive contamination
Computer virus/electronic data corruption
Valuable items over £5,000 single article value (Valuables/Electrical Valuables)
Theft without police crime reference number
Malicious damage without police crime reference number
Claims where deposit exceeds policy excess
Damage caused by guests/visitors where guest/visitor is also legally liable (for liability section)
Liability relating to food/drink provision
Swimming pool-related liability
Sporting equipment liability
Claims without evidence of guest damage during valid booking
Loss of income for bookings made after insured event
Loss of income for 14 days immediately after insured event

sub_limits.Valuables (Contents): £20,000 total per claim, £5,000 per single article
sub_limits.Electrical Valuables (Contents): £20,000 total per claim, £5,000 per single article
sub_limits.Building construction/extension work: Must not exceed £6,000 including VAT for contract disputes

special_conditions: Must have valid annual Property Policy in place throughout period of insurance
Property owner must inform property insurer within 30 days that short-term letting may occur
Cover must be in place before guests arrive
Written agreement required between host and guest (or verbal for family/friends)
Maximum 20 people (10 adults/10 children) staying at any one time
Property must be well maintained in good state of repair
Property must be equipped with essential items (curtains, beds, furniture)
Valid gas safety certificate required if applicable
Must comply with fire safety regulations
Must operate in compliance with local authority regulations and laws
Must provide adequate instruction to guests on use of premises
No renovations/structural alterations during guest stays
Host must retain full deposit paid by guest
Must report theft/malicious damage to police immediately and obtain crime reference
Claims must be reported within 30 days of discovery
Multiple instances during single booking treated as one claim (single excess applies)
Property rebuild value must be less than £1,000,000
Property not Grade 1 listed (England/Wales) or Grade A listed (Scotland/NI)
Property not thatched or part-thatched
UK or Isle of Man resident only (not Channel Islands)
No more than 2 property/host insurance claims in last 12 months or 3 in last 5 years
No unspent criminal convictions (except spent convictions and motoring offences)
Must agree to provide/give permission to access letting history with platform
excess_deductible: £100 excess applies to most claims (Building, Contents, EV Charging, Liability, Emergency Services, Key Replacement). No excess specified for some benefits like alternative accommodation and kennelling costs.
geographical_coverage: United Kingdom including Northern Ireland (not Channel Islands). Legal Expenses section also covers UK, Isle of Man, Channel Islands and EU law matters.
age_restrictions: Not explicitly specified for policyholders. Fatal bodily injury benefit applies regardless of age.
pre_existing_conditions: Not applicable to this property insurance type. However, ongoing medical conditions excluded from personal injury claims.
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling off period for full refund (unless claim made or incident likely to result in claim). After 14 days, no refund given and all outstanding premiums become due. Insurer may cancel with 14 days notice for valid reasons (non-payment, threatening behavior, non-compliance, failure to provide documents, fraud).

endorsements.name: Section 1a - Buildings (Insured Property)
endorsements.description: Applies to properties that are NOT flats/apartments. Covers building structure, fixtures/fittings, garages, outbuildings, driveways, gardens, pools, solar panels, etc.
endorsements.cost_impact: Not specified - included in base policy selection
endorsements.coverage_impact: Provides higher limits than flat/apartment structure coverage (e.g., £1m for fire vs £50k for flats)

endorsements.name: Section 1b - Buildings (Flat/Apartment Structures)
endorsements.description: Applies where insured premises IS a flat/apartment. Covers internal walls, doors, fixtures/fittings only. Excludes external walls, roofs, communal areas.
endorsements.cost_impact: Not specified - included in base policy selection
endorsements.coverage_impact: Lower limits than full buildings cover (£50,000 vs £80,000-£1m). Excludes external structure and communal areas.

endorsements.name: Section 2 - Contents
endorsements.description: Covers household items, valuables, electrical valuables, personal belongings inside premises, garages, outbuildings and gardens
endorsements.coverage_impact: Sub-limits apply for valuables and electrical valuables (£20k total, £5k per item)

endorsements.name: Section 3 - Loss of Income
endorsements.description: Covers loss of rental income when property uninhabitable due to covered claim
endorsements.coverage_impact: 14-day waiting period applies. Only bookings made before insured event covered. Max £10,000.

endorsements.name: Section 4 - Electric and Hybrid Home Charging Units
endorsements.description: Covers damage to EV charging points used by guests
endorsements.coverage_impact: Limited to £1,500. Excludes improper installation/maintenance and incorrect use by host.

endorsements.name: Section 5 - Liability to Others
endorsements.description: Covers legal liability for property damage or bodily injury to third parties, guests, or visitors arising from hosting activities
endorsements.coverage_impact: Up to £5m including legal costs. Excludes liability from food/drink, swimming pools, sporting equipment, professional business activities.

endorsements.name: Section 6 - Legal Expenses
endorsements.description: Covers legal costs for contract disputes, repossession of guests, personal injury claims, and tax enquiries related to hosting
endorsements.coverage_impact: Up to £50,000. Must have reasonable prospects of success (>50% chance). Minimum claim £100. ARAG controls appointment of advisors initially.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: Must contact insurer as soon as reasonably possible and in any event no later than 30 days from discovery of incident or event that might lead to claim
required_documents: Full details of loss or damage
Evidence of ownership (receipts, instruction manuals, guarantee cards, valuations, photographs)
Pre and post letting inspection reports
Pre-purchase surveys, plans or deeds (if relevant)
Police crime reference number (for theft or malicious damage)
Proof that guest damage occurred during valid booking
Written agreement between host and guest
Claim form, application notice, legal document or correspondence (for liability claims)
process_steps: 1. Contact insurer within 30 days of discovering incident
2. Provide name, policy number, and full details of loss/damage
3. For theft/malicious damage: Report to police immediately and obtain crime reference
4. Do NOT dispose of damaged items or carry out permanent repairs before insurer inspection
5. Do NOT abandon property to insurer
6. Take reasonable steps to minimize further loss/damage
7. For liability claims: Do NOT admit/deny responsibility or make agreements with third parties
9. Allow insurer access to property for inspection if required
10. Cooperate fully with insurer and appointed assessors/contractors
11. Submit estimates for repairs/replacement if requested
12. Claim back legal costs where possible from other parties
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Police crime reference number mandatory for theft/malicious damage. Proof of ownership (receipts). Evidence of valid booking. Proof guest damage occurred during valid booking. Pre/post inspection reports. Photographs. Letting history. Written short-let agreement. Evidence deposit retained from guest.
claims_requirements.claims_contact: 24 Hour Claims Line: 0800 032 7327 | Website: www.prestigeunderwriting.co.uk/claims | Post: Prestige Underwriting, 4th Floor, Lanyon Building, North Derby Street, Belfast, BT15 3HL | Legal Expenses Claims: 0117 917 1698 or www.arag.co.uk/newclaims

eligibility_criteria.age_limits: No specific age limits stated for policyholders
eligibility_criteria.medical_restrictions: Policyholders or permanent residents must not have ongoing/gradual medical conditions that could lead to death (for personal injury cover)
eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Must not be operating as a business except for hosting activities. Professional business activities excluded from liability cover.
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be UK or Isle of Man resident (Channel Islands NOT included). Property must be located in UK (including Northern Ireland).
other_restrictions: Must be property owner or have legal responsibility for property
If tenant, must have written landlord permission to act as host
No more than 2 property/host insurance claims in last 12 months
No more than 3 property/host insurance claims in last 5 years
No unspent criminal convictions (except motoring offences) for policyholder or permanent residents
Property not Grade 1 listed (England/Wales) or Grade A listed (Scotland/NI)
Property well maintained, in good repair, not undergoing renovation
Less than 20 people (10 adults/10 children) staying at any one time
Must have existing Property Policy in place
Must operate in compliance with local authority regulations and laws
Must agree to provide/permit access to letting history with platform

policy_definitions.Accidental Damage: Accidental sudden and unintentional loss or destruction of or damage to the Host's property
policy_definitions.Bodily Injury: Death or physical injury caused by a sudden and unexpected external visible event
policy_definitions.Charging Point: Hybrid or electric vehicle charging unit including connections and cables that connect to a vehicle for electrical charging
policy_definitions.Communicable Disease: Any disease transmitted by substance/agent (virus, bacteria, parasite) whether direct or indirect transmission, including COVID-19 and any pandemic - THIS IS EXCLUDED
policy_definitions.Contents: Household items including valuables, electrical valuables and personal belongings inside insured premises (garages, outbuildings, gardens). Does NOT include motorized vehicles, charging points, documents or domestic pets
policy_definitions.Deposit: Amount collected by host from guest to cover potential loss/damage during guest's valid booking
policy_definitions.Electrical Valuables: Tablets, laptops, phones, home computers, monitors, satellite decoders and audio/video equipment
policy_definitions.Excess: The first amount of each and every claim for which you are responsible (£100 for most claims)
policy_definitions.Family: Husband, wife, partner, civil partner, person living as though married, children (including adopted/foster), and any other immediate family
policy_definitions.Flat/Apartment Structure: Fixtures/fittings and internal walls/doors (including entrance door) that form separate premises within a building adapted for dwelling. Does NOT include external walls, roofs, or communal areas
policy_definitions.Fixtures and Fittings: Built-in furniture/appliances, fixed glass, sanitary ware, external lighting, alarm systems, surveillance equipment, pipes, ducts, wires, cables, tanks, switches, fires, heating equipment, ground source pumps, boilers, storage heaters, wind turbines, solar panels, floor coverings, balconies, terraces, hot tubs, saunas
policy_definitions.Guest: (a) Person(s) including family/traveling companions who host has agreed may stay at insured premises for agreed period under written short let agreement; AND (b) Family or friends who host has agreed may stay for agreed period without charge
policy_definitions.Host: The person(s) or company named on policy schedule at insured premises who have agreed to allow guests onto their property
policy_definitions.Hosting Activity: Any activity performed to fulfill host's legal obligations under written short let agreement with guest, or verbal agreement for family/friends staying for agreed period
policy_definitions.Insured Premises: The insured property or flat/apartment structure owned by you or for which you are legally responsible, let by host and registered under this policy. Does NOT include charging points
policy_definitions.Insured Property: Building/structure including fixtures/fittings, garages, outbuildings, driveways, gardens, tennis courts, patios, paths, walls, fences, gates, hedges, drains, pipes, cables, tanks, septic tanks, heating fuel tanks, swimming pools, saunas, hot tubs, solar panels, wind turbines, ground source heating pumps. Does NOT include charging points
policy_definitions.Loss of Income: Amount of monetary benefit host would have received from guest for hosting activity excluding amounts payable to third parties (fees/commission)
policy_definitions.Malicious Damage: Any act of intended damage to insured premises or its contents
policy_definitions.Period of Insurance: The period shown on policy schedule as the period of insurance
policy_definitions.Platform: Any website which connects the guest with the host
policy_definitions.Property Policy: A property insurance policy covering damage to insured premises when NOT used for hosting activity, caused by perils such as flood, storm, landslip, heave, subsidence, escape of water, fire, smoke, theft, together with liability to others coverage
policy_definitions.Reasonable Costs: Costs for goods and services which are competitive in the relevant marketplace
policy_definitions.Terrorism: Use of biological/chemical/nuclear force or contamination by any person/group for political/religious/ideological purposes including intent to influence government(s) or put public in fear - THIS IS EXCLUDED
policy_definitions.Theft: Any act of fraud or dishonesty committed with clear intent of obtaining improper financial gain for themselves or others
policy_definitions.Valid Booking: A property rental booking for a guest for an agreed period of time
policy_definitions.Valuables: Jewellery, watches, precious gems/stones, bullion, gold/silver plated articles, precious metals, furs, pictures, paintings, works of art
policy_definitions.Visitor: Person(s) present at insured premises due to invitation/actions of guest and NOT included under written short let agreement between host and guest

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: 14 complete days after insured event before loss of income claims can be made
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: 30 days maximum from discovery of incident to report claim. Must report theft/malicious damage to police IMMEDIATELY. Must inform property insurer within 30 days of starting or potentially starting hosting activity.
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Claims must be reported during period of insurance and as soon as first aware of circumstances which could give rise to claim. For legal expenses: must report during period of insurance.
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from date of purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later) for full refund (unless claim made or incident likely to result in claim)

common_questions.question: Do I need a separate property insurance policy to have this cover?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you must have a valid annual Property Policy in place during the entire period of insurance for this Pikl policy. This is a mandatory eligibility requirement. The Pikl policy works alongside your existing property insurance to provide additional cover for hosting activities.
common_questions.section_reference: Eligibility section, General Policy Conditions - Other Insurance

common_questions.question: Does this policy cover damage caused by my own family or permanent residents?
common_questions.answer: No. This policy only covers damage caused by Guests (people staying under a short-term letting agreement) or Visitors (people invited by Guests). It specifically excludes damage caused by you, your family, or anyone permanently residing at the insured premises.
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Exclusions - Damage caused by You

common_questions.question: What happens if my guest's deposit is more than the claim value?
common_questions.answer: If the deposit paid by the guest is greater than or equal to the value of the claim, the policy will not pay out. Additionally, if the deposit exceeds the policy excess (£100), the insurer will deduct the amount that exceeds the excess from any claim settlement.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Exclusions - Deposits; How much we will pay

common_questions.question: Is damage from COVID-19 or other pandemics covered?
common_questions.answer: No. There is a comprehensive communicable disease exclusion that specifically includes COVID-19 and any pandemic or disease that can be transmitted between organisms. This exclusion applies to all sections of the policy.
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Exclusions - Communicable Disease

common_questions.question: How quickly must I report a claim?
common_questions.answer: You must contact the insurer as soon as reasonably possible and in any event no later than 30 days from the discovery of any incident or event that might lead to a claim. For theft or malicious damage, you must also inform the police IMMEDIATELY and obtain a crime reference number.
common_questions.section_reference: General Claims Conditions - Your Duties

common_questions.question: Can I claim for wear and tear or gradual damage?
common_questions.answer: No. The policy excludes any loss or damage due to general wear and tear, anything which happens gradually, mould, rot, rust, mechanical or electrical breakdown, malfunction, fault, or equipment being used against manufacturer's advice.
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Exclusions - Wear and Tear

common_questions.question: Are my expensive jewelry and electronics covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, but with significant limitations. Valuables (jewelry, watches, precious items) and Electrical Valuables (tablets, laptops, phones, etc.) are covered up to £20,000 total per claim, but each single item is limited to £5,000. Valuables must be kept in a locked safe or locked room inaccessible to guests when not attended.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 2 - Contents, How much we will pay

common_questions.question: What if my property becomes uninhabitable due to a covered claim?
common_questions.answer: The policy will pay for: (1) Alternative accommodation for you and your family at up to £200/day (max £20,000); (2) Alternative accommodation for guests who were staying at time of incident at up to £150/day (max £5,000); (3) Kennelling costs for your animals at up to £50/day (max £5,000); (4) Cancellation charges for subsequent bookings up to £200. Note: Does not cover food or drinks.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1a/1b - Buildings

common_questions.question: Does this cover my liability if a guest is injured?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Section 5 covers your legal liability for bodily injury to third parties, guests, or visitors arising from hosting activities, up to £5,000,000 including legal costs. However, it excludes liability from your deliberate/reckless acts, liability for injury caused by professional business activities (except hosting), food/drink provision, swimming pools, and sporting equipment.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 5 - Your Liability to Others

common_questions.question: Are there any restrictions on the type of property I can insure?
common_questions.answer: Yes. The property must not be: Grade 1 listed (England/Wales) or Grade A listed (Scotland/NI); thatched or part-thatched; have a rebuild value of £1,000,000 or more; be undergoing renovation; or have more than 20 people (10 adults/10 children) staying at any one time. It must be well maintained, in good repair, and located in the UK (including NI, but not Channel Islands).
common_questions.section_reference: Eligibility section

common_questions.question: What is covered for loss of rental income?
common_questions.answer: If your property is uninhabitable due to repairs following a covered claim under Sections 1a, 1b, or 2, the policy will pay for loss of rental income up to £10,000. However, there is a 14-day waiting period (no payment for the immediate 14 complete days after the insured event), and only bookings made BEFORE the insured event are covered. You must have a contractual written agreement showing the booking.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 3 - Loss of income following a claim

common_questions.question: Is my electric vehicle charging point covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, if you permit guests to use it as part of hosting activities. Section 4 covers accidental damage, malicious damage, and theft of charging points up to £1,500 per claim. However, it excludes damage from incorrect use by you, improper installation/maintenance, and non-adherence to regulations and manufacturer guidelines.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 4 - Electric and Hybrid Home Charging Units

common_questions.question: Can I claim for damage caused during cleaning?
common_questions.answer: No. The policy specifically excludes any loss or damage that occurs because of professional or domestic cleaning.
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Exclusions - Professional/Domestic Cleaning

common_questions.question: What legal expenses are covered?
common_questions.answer: Section 6 covers legal costs up to £50,000 for: (1) Contract disputes arising from buying/hiring goods or services or privately selling goods related to hosting; (2) Evicting guests after their agreed stay period; (3) Personal injury caused by guest/visitor actions; (4) Formal HMRC tax enquiries into personal tax affairs related to hosting. Cover requires reasonable prospects of success (>50% chance) and minimum £100 claim value.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 6 - Legal Expenses

common_questions.question: What happens if I want to cancel my policy?
common_questions.answer: Within 14 days of purchase or receipt of documents (whichever is later): Full refund unless you've made a claim or there's been an incident likely to result in a claim. After 14 days: No refund and all outstanding premiums become due. The insurer can also cancel with 14 days' notice for valid reasons (non-payment, threatening behavior, non-compliance, failure to provide documents, fraud).
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Conditions - Cancellation

common_questions.question: Does my existing home insurance know about my short-term letting?
common_questions.answer: You MUST inform your Property Policy insurer within 30 days that there is or may be short-term letting activity at the property. This is a mandatory eligibility requirement. Failure to do so could invalidate both policies.
common_questions.section_reference: Eligibility section

common_questions.question: Are there limits on how many claims I can make?
common_questions.answer: To be eligible for this policy, you and anyone who permanently resides with you must not have had more than 2 property insurance or host insurance claims in the last 12 months or more than 3 in the last 5 years. There's no stated limit on claims during the policy period, but multiple instances during a single valid booking are treated as one claim with one excess.
common_questions.section_reference: Eligibility - About You; General Claims Conditions

common_questions.question: What excess do I need to pay on claims?
common_questions.answer: £100 excess applies to most claims including buildings, contents, EV charging, liability, emergency services damage, and key replacement claims. No excess is specified for alternative accommodation, kennelling costs, or some other benefits. The excess is the first amount of each claim for which you are responsible.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1a, 1b, 2, 4, 5 - What is not Covered sections; Definitions - Excess

common_questions.question: Is damage caused by my dog or cat covered?
common_questions.answer: No. The policy specifically excludes any loss or damage caused by domestic pets, including but not limited to chewing, scratching, tearing, and fouling. However, Section 5 covers your liability for injury caused by domesticated cats or dogs (except 'specially controlled dogs' under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991).
common_questions.section_reference: General Policy Exclusions - Domestic Pets; Section 5 - What is not Covered

common_questions.question: Can I use my own contractor or repairer for claims?
common_questions.answer: The insurer may appoint an approved contractor or supplier to validate your claim and arrange quotations, repairs, or replacements. For legal expenses claims, unless there's a conflict of interest or proceedings need to be/have been issued, the insurer will choose the appointed advisor. If you choose your own, the insurer will not pay more than they would pay their panel solicitor.
common_questions.section_reference: How much we will pay; Legal Expenses Conditions - Freedom to choose an appointed advisor
